Key Match Events: Aiden Markram held a superb running effort from over his shoulder off the first ball of the final over to seal the win
Harry Brook went into the final instalment with 14 runs still needed to chase down a target of 164
Quinton de Kock hit a crucial knock of 65
Jofra Archer took three for 40 with a 12th over that cost three runs but saw the uppercut fly into Buttler's glove
Sam Curran could hit only one boundary in the final over
David Miller's 43 burnished South Africa's 163 for six
Jos Buttler's pick-up-and-throw saw Heinrich Klaasen run out for eight
Brook and Curran took two fine diving catches to buff up Archer's figures
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler said that De Kock came out with a lot of intensity and England couldn't quite match that
Buttler also said that South Africa bowled well in the powerplay and De Kock's innings was probably the difference
Miscellaneous Highlights: The surface was slow and much changed from the two previous night games
The match was a battle for all but a handful of players on this slow surface in the scorching daytime heat
Reeza Hendricks laboured to 19 from 25 balls before holing out off Moeen Ali in the 10th over
The third umpire concluded De Kock's splayed fingers had failed to prevent the ball touching grass
Others: England can still progress to the semi-finals provided they beat USA in Barbados earlier that day and West Indies lose to South Africa in Antigua on Sunday night
